column4: Docfixit: try sudo apt-get check, or does the system not come up at all?
Ubuntu comes up.  The app doesn't come up.
double commander
It installes fine.  When I run it from terminal I get the error.
no.  I installed it with software center.
It's downloaded.  How can I install it with root?
yes
I get a command prompt with no errors.
I'm running on a usb thumbdrive.  Does Ubuntu know to write all changes to the persistant partition?
It said 1 newly installed.
When I run it I get an error with lots of lines that start with Start watching.
The next line says: Cannot get device list  (only when you get a chance.  I realize you are busy)
are you starting it as root? i.e. (gksudo doublecmd)
When I start it as root I don't get the error.  It also doesn't run.
lol... are there any error messages?
no error messages.
try typing "locate doublecmd" and when you get the full path, type that
(precede the full path with gksudo, of course)
I'm out of ideas, but here's a link to the doublecmd forum... maybe there's some help there: http://doublecmd.sourceforge.net/forum/viewforum.php?f=5
Thank you very much for all your help.
if you are still here, I found this, which might help: http://ubuntu.se/archive/index.php/t-14899.html?s=edd5884cb0c89b448ad2bd9807bf1b87
